alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Western Chesterfield; Western Henrico (Including the City of Richmond) (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 20 at 3:18PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CHESTERFIELD AND SOUTHEASTERN AMELIA COUNTIES AND THE CITY OF RICHMOND THROUGH 345 PM EDT... At 317 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mannboro, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of Chesterfield and southeastern Amelia Counties and the City of Richmond, including the following locations... Pocahontas State Park, Skinquarter, Beach, Winterpock, Ammon, Midlothian, Drewrys Bluff, Centralia, and Chesterfield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Amelia; Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Western Chesterfield; Western Henrico (Including the City of Richmond)
